metadata.title: USN-7162-1 -- curl vulnerability
metadata.description: Harry Sintonen discovered that curl incorrectly handled credentials from .netrc files when following HTTP redirects. In certain configurations, the password for the first host could be leaked to the followed-to host, contrary to expectations.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7162-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  curl - 8.9.1-2ubuntu2.2 libcurl3t64-gnutls - 8.9.1-2ubuntu2.2 libcurl4-doc - 8.9.1-2ubuntu2.2 libcurl4-gnutls-dev - 8.9.1-2ubuntu2.2 libcurl4-openssl-dev - 8.9.1-2ubuntu2.2 libcurl4t64 - 8.9.1-2ubuntu2.2 No subscription required
